description._content:
Caption:  The Mennonite Evangelical Home for Boys.  This boys orphanage at Bragado had dormitories, baths, a small sewing room, and Sister Pinyro's room in the right wing.  In thte center is the dining room and the kitchen and the left wing are rooms fof the Siebers.  The windmill pumps water into a tank on top of the building providing cold running water in the kitchen and baths.  The front yard is cut up with paths, leaving thirteen small geometrical spaces where grass, shrubbery and flowers are planted.

Citation: Mennonite Board of Missions. Photographs. Argentina, 1937-1954.  IV-10-7.2 Box 1 folder 46, photo #1. Mennonite Church USA Archives - Goshen. Goshen, Indiana.
